revised_title: Ultrastructural Study of Oospore Development in Bremia lactucae
tldr: This article describes the ultrastructural study of oospore development in Bremia lactucae, an obligate biotroph responsible for the downy mildew disease of lettuce. The study focuses on the process of oogenesis, including the formation of oogonia and antheridia, fertilization, and oospore maturation. The findings provide insights into the abortion stages of the development process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
